Line 17: Line 17:
'''Knoppix''', or '''KNOPPIX''', is a [[Linux distribution]] based on [[Debian]] designed to be run directly from a [[Compact Disc|CD]] / [[DVD]]. Knoppix is one of the best-known [[LiveDistro]]s. Knoppix was developed by Linux consultant [[Klaus Knopper]]. When starting a program it is loaded from the [[optical disc]] and decompressed into a [[RAM drive]]. The decompression is [[transparency (computing)|transparent]] and [[on-the-fly]].
'''Knoppix''', or '''KNOPPIX''', is a [[Linux distribution]] based on [[Debian]] designed to be run directly from a [[Compact Disc|CD]] / [[DVD]]. Knoppix is one of the best-known [[LiveDistro]]s. Knoppix was developed by Linux consultant [[Klaus Knopper]]. When starting a program it is loaded from the [[optical disc]] and decompressed into a [[RAM drive]]. The decompression is [[transparency (computing)|transparent]] and [[on-the-fly]].
â
Although Knoppix is primarily designed to be used as a [[LiveCD]], it can also be installed on a [[hard disk]] like a typical operating system. Computers that support booting from USB devices can load Knoppix from a [[live USB]] [[USB flash drive|flash drive]] or [[memory card]].
+
Although Knoppix is primarily designed to be used as a [[Live CD]], it can also be installed on a [[hard disk]] like a typical operating system. Computers that support booting from USB devices can load Knoppix from a [[live USB]] [[USB flash drive|flash drive]] or [[memory card]].
There are two main editions of Knoppix: the traditional [[Compact Disc]] (700 [[megabyte]]s) edition and the [[DVD]] (4.7 [[gigabyte]]s) "Maxi" edition. Each of these main editions has two language-specific editions: [[English language|English]] and [[German language|German]].
There are two main editions of Knoppix: the traditional [[Compact Disc]] (700 [[megabyte]]s) edition and the [[DVD]] (4.7 [[gigabyte]]s) "Maxi" edition. Each of these main editions has two language-specific editions: [[English language|English]] and [[German language|German]].
Line 24: Line 24:
== Usage ==
== Usage ==
â
Knoppix can be used to back up files easily from hard drives with inaccessible operating systems. To quickly and more safely use Linux software the [[LiveCD]] can be used instead of installing another OS.
+
Knoppix can be used to back up files easily from hard drives with inaccessible operating systems. To quickly and more safely use Linux software the [[Live CD]] can be used instead of installing another OS.
== Contents ==
== Contents ==
Line 66: Line 66:
== Boot options ==
== Boot options ==
â
When using Knoppix as a [[LiveCD]], one can use boot options, also known as 'cheatcodes', to override a default setting or automatic hardware detection when it fails. For example, the user may wish to boot into a plain console, or proceed without SCSI support. For this, Knoppix allows the user to enter one or more cheat codes at the prompt before booting. If the user doesn't enter a cheat code, or doesn't press any key before the timeout, Knoppix will boot with its default options. For example, to set the language to French rather than the default, one would type:
+
When using Knoppix as a [[Live CD]], one can use boot options, also known as 'cheatcodes', to override a default setting or automatic hardware detection when it fails. For example, the user may wish to boot into a plain console, or proceed without SCSI support. For this, Knoppix allows the user to enter one or more cheat codes at the prompt before booting. If the user doesn't enter a cheat code, or doesn't press any key before the timeout, Knoppix will boot with its default options. For example, to set the language to French rather than the default, one would type:
<code>knoppix lang=fr</code><ref name="Cheat codes"/>
<code>knoppix lang=fr</code><ref name="Cheat codes"/>
== Popularity ==
== Popularity ==
â
Knoppix was one of the first LiveCD Linux distributions to gain popularity.<ref>[http://polishlinux.org/choose/live-cd/ polishlinux.org - Live CD]</ref> There are factors that contribute to the popularity of Knoppix:
+
Knoppix was one of the first Live CD Linux distributions to gain popularity.<ref>[http://polishlinux.org/choose/live-cd/ polishlinux.org - Live CD]</ref> There are factors that contribute to the popularity of Knoppix:
â
* Knoppix was one of the first [[LiveCD]]s available, and is known as the "original" Debian-based [[LiveCD]]
+
* Knoppix was one of the first [[Live CD]]s available, and is known as the "original" Debian-based [[Live CD]]
* Its extensive hardware detection allows most systems to start Knoppix without any configuration
* Its extensive hardware detection allows most systems to start Knoppix without any configuration
* Its ability to automatically connect to most kinds of [[Computer network|networks]]
* Its ability to automatically connect to most kinds of [[Computer network|networks]]
Line 156: Line 156:

* [[Feather Linux]], 128 MB image with Linux 2.4, works as a [[Live CD]] and [[Live USB]]
* [[Feather Linux]], 128 MB image with Linux 2.4, works as a [[Live CD]] and [[Live USB]]
â
* Flonix USB Edition, an old liveCD
+

* [[Guadalinex]], [[Spanish language|Spanish]]
* [[Helix (Linux distribution)|Helix]], focusing on the computer security areas of forensics, data discovery and incident response
